title: Extracting Userdata from Userdata.bin file backup of oneplus 7pro mobile
content:
I have userdata backup file (Userdata.bin) of oneplus 7pro. I want to extract photos and videos from this. when i used the command "binwalk userdata.bin" it shows

i did not know where this data is included... It may be here - 402652160 0x17FFFC00 Linux EXT filesystem, blocks count: 59463283, image size: 60890401792, rev 1.0, ext4 filesystem data, UUID=9c665de0-9d83-42e0-bd1d-34377c027c02, volume name "data" So how can i extract it with binwalk or any other tool ? Did this block contains my data ? Thanks in advance

comments.text: did you try binwalk -e Userdata.bin or binwalk --dd=".*" Userdata.bin ?

Yes i have tried.. binwalk -e Userdata.bin or binwalk --dd=".*" Userdata.bin both command giving same output... gzip, lzma, and a lot of files and no files can not be extracted... The userdata is only 225gb ( exactly it is only around 20gb) it shows 225 because this mobile have 256gb internal storage. This is encrypted data so before extracting the data it should be decrypted... but i did not know how to do it....... Anybody please help

answers_data.content: I have heard of people getting the data partition from the phone... then resetting the phone back to stock and then push the userdata partition back onto the device. booting it up and letting the phone decrypt the userdata partition. then you have access to the files :)

comments.text: Without providing guidance on how to do it, this is more of a commentary than a helpful answer.
